Comment: You don't have a sarcasm indicator, so I'll assume you're serious. An importer buys $1000 of goods. Trump put a 10% tariff on that country. The importer pays $1000 to the exporter, and $100 to the US government. They now need to get $1100 (plus profit) from whomever they sell it to. Unless someone is willing to eat that increased cost, that extra cost gets passed along until the consumer pays it.
